docs.snippet: The notion that the competition between Mark Sanchez and Geno Smith is, as the quarterbacks coach says, “too close to call” must be somewhat discouraging to the Jets....
docs.lead_paragraph: The notion that the competition between Mark Sanchez and Geno Smith is, as the quarterbacks coach says, “too close to call” must be somewhat discouraging to the Jets.
docs.abstract: Ben Shpigel On Pro Football column contends that with competition between Mark Sanchez and Geno Smith for starting quarterback still too close to call, New York Jets must be somewhat discouraged; observes that Sanchez is in his fifth year and yet to distinguish himself from a rookie.

headline.main: Quarterback? Jets Have Yet to Decide
headline.print_headline: Quarterback? Jets Have Yet To Decide

docs.snippet: Citing a lack of editorial control, ESPN ended its collaboration with the public affairs series “Frontline” on a two-part documentary set to run in October....
docs.lead_paragraph: Citing a lack of editorial control, ESPN ended its collaboration with the public affairs series “Frontline” on a two-part documentary set to run in October.
docs.abstract: ESPN ends its official association with public television's Frontline on two-part documentary about concussions in the NFL scheduled to be aired in October; after 15 months on the venture, ESPN chose to strip its name, logo and credit from the films, League of Denial: The NFL’s Concussion Crisis, citing clash over editorial control.

headline.main: ESPN Quits Film Project on Concussions in N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: ESPN Quits Project On N.F.L. Concussions

docs.snippet: The N.F.L. and its players union continued trading barbs about the league’s drug testing regimen and the implementation of a preliminary test for human growth hormone....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. and its players union continued trading barbs about the league’s drug testing regimen and the implementation of a preliminary test for human growth hormone.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; NFL and players union continue trading barbs about league’s drug-testing regimen and implementation of preliminary test for human growth hormone, with less than two weeks before rosters must be cut; other football news noted.

headline.main: More Barbs Exchanged Over H.G.H. Test Delay
headline.print_headline: More Barbs Exchanged Over H.G.H. Test Delay

docs.snippet: Lazio's notorious Curva Nord section in Rome's Olympic Stadium will stay shut for Sunday's Serie A match against Udinese after the Italian Football Federation (FIGC) rejected the club's appeal against the one-game closure....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lazio's notorious Curva Nord section in Rome's Olympic Stadium will stay shut for Sunday's Serie A match against Udinese after the Italian Football Federation (FIGC) rejected the club's appeal against the one-game closure.
